B. Residency Requirement: The primary care provider must reside in
the Child Day Care Home. No additional employees are permitted in the
operation of the Child Day Care Home with the exception of a substitute
who provides care during planned absences of the primary caregiver, as
allowed by the North Carolina Department of Health and Human
Services Division of Child Development.
C. Fencing: All rear yards for a Child Day Care Home shall be fenced or
walled. The minimum height for such walls or fences shall be four feet.
D. Restrictions on Use of Yard Area: All equipment pertaining to the
operation of a Child Day Care Home, to include toys, shall be stored in
the rear yard. Front yards shall not be used as playground areas.
E. Building and Fire Inspections Required: A building inspection and
a fire safety inspection shall be completed for all Child Day Care Homes
prior to zoning approval by the Town.
F. Hours: Hours of operation for a Child Day Care Homes shall be
permitted from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.
G. Proximity to Similar Facilities: A Child Day Care Home, required to
be licensed by the State of North Carolina, may not be located within
one-half mile radius of an existing Child Day Care Home.
